data.description: Surveys both theoretical and ethnographic writing from the 1970s to the present in order to critically examine anthropology's ongoing efforts to decolonize. How have anthropologists confronted their discipline's colonial history? How have they integrated theories and insight from subaltern, postcolonial, and decolonial scholars? How can anthropologists ensure that they continue to decolonize their methods?
data.title: ANTHROPOLOGY FROM COLONIALISM TO DECOLONIALITY
